head.title: Sua Wins Discus Title For 4th Straight Year

series.series.name: PLUS: TRACK AND FIELD -- N.C.A.A. CHAMPIONSHIPS

hedline.hl1: Sua Wins Discus Title For 4th Straight Year

abstract.p: National Collegiate Athletic Association track and field championships continue at Duke University in Durham, NC; results noted (S)

block.p: Seilala Sua of U.C.L.A. won her fourth consecutive women's discus title at the National Collegiate Athletic Association track and field championships yesterday at Duke University in Durham, N.C.

The 22-year-old anthropology major from Cooper City, Fla., produced a winning throw of 200 feet 9 inches, nearly 14 feet better than Cheree Hicks of Syracuse, who was second at 187-0. Sua will attempt to add her second straight N.C.A.A. shot-put title today.
Seilala Sua of U.C.L.A. won her fourth consecutive women's discus title at the National Collegiate Athletic Association track and field championships yesterday at Duke University in Durham, N.C.

The 22-year-old anthropology major from Cooper City, Fla., produced a winning throw of 200 feet 9 inches, nearly 14 feet better than Cheree Hicks of Syracuse, who was second at 187-0. Sua will attempt to add her second straight N.C.A.A. shot-put title today.

Libor Charfreitag, a 22-year-old Southern Methodist junior from Slovakia, won the men's hammer throw for the second time in three years. His throw of 253-4 not only gave him the victory, but also broke his own national record and won him a place on the Slovak national team for the Sydney Olympic Games in September.
PLUS: TRACK AND FIELD -- N.C.A.A. CHAMPIONSHIPS
